wikipedia_page.main: Philip Graves (born 7 April 1989 in York) is a British triathlete. In 2009, he became the youngest triathlete to win an Ironman competition, at age 20, when he won the Ironman UK race.

response: In his journeys, Philip Graves developed an interest in entomology and published articles in scientific journals. He was member of the Royal Irish Academy.
*Ballylickey Manor House, County Cork, Ireland.  Now a hotel run by a son of Philip Graves

link_mentions.page: Great Britain at the 2015 European Games
